sections.title: Qualifying costs for all projects
sections.description: Complete all fields, using '0' if you have no costs.

fields.label: inset6
fields.infoText: We will only consider costs for R&D activities that qualify for R&D tax relief.

fields.label: Staff costs
fields.errorMessage: Enter a numeric value for each field. Use ‘0’ if no expenditure is applicable.

fields.label: What staff costs qualify for relief?
fields.infoText:
You can include:

-    salary before tax
including cash bonuses and overtime pay 
-    reimbursed staff expenses to do with R&D activities (where staff have paid for their expenses before the company pays them back)
-    National Insurance contributions
-    pension contributions

fields.label: Costs for connected externally provided workers (EPWs)

fields.errorMessage: Enter a numeric value for each field. Use ‘0’ if no expenditure is applicable.

fields.label: Software
fields.helpText:
Include software licence fees bought for
use in the R&D process
fields.errorMessage: Enter a numeric value for each field. Use ‘0’ if no expenditure is applicable.

fields.label: Consumables
fields.helpText:
Include expenditure on materials consumed or transformed in
the R&D process. For example, water, fuel, power and laboratory consumables used in trials

tests

sections.title: Research and development project 1
sections.description: Tell us about the projects for which you have claimed in your Corporation Tax return.

fields.label: Maximum
fields.infoText:
If you’ve claimed:
- one to 3 projects, you must include all project details
- 4 or more projects, you must include all details on at least 3 to a maximum of 10 projects which cover 50% or more of the total qualifying costs of your claim

fields.label: Project name
fields.errorMessage: Enter name of project

fields.label: What level of scientific or technical knowledge existed at the start of the project?
fields.shortName: Scientific or technical knowledge at the start
fields.helpText: Summarise the knowledge which was available in public at the start of your project that you planned to improve. Keep to 3,000 characters (including spaces), or 500 words
fields.errorMessage: Summarise level of scientific or technical knowledge at the start of the project

fields.infoText: **What advance in that knowledge did you aim to achieve?**

fields.label: What is an advance in knowledge or capability?
fields.infoText:
An advance in knowledge or capability in science or technology may have physical consequences or may be an increase in overall knowledge, but in either case, a competent professional working in that field would recognise it as a significant improvement.

The improvements may include:
- creating a process, material, device, product or service that increases the knowledge or capability 
- a visible improvement to an existing process, material, device, product or service like cost savings or less waste
- using science or technology to copy the effect of a current process, material, device, product or service in a new or improved way

fields.helpText: List the goals of your R&D project, and explain the improvements you planned to make. Keep to 3,000 characters (including spaces), or 500 words
fields.errorMessage: Enter the knowledge you aimed to achieve

fields.infoText: **What scientific or technological uncertainties did you face?**

fields.label: What type of uncertainties should I outline?
fields.infoText:
Uncertainties may be when you either:

- do not know if it is possible to create or improve the product or process
- know the product or process can be created from your research but it's too costly 

For example, you tried to build a medical diagnostic tool combining non-invasive testing technology, artificial intelligence (AI) and portability, but you're not sure about the method of updating the AI with the latest medical knowledge.

fields.helpText: Describe the obstacles that you found and tried to overcome to achieve the improvements. Keep to 3,000 characters (including spaces), or 500 words
fields.errorMessage: Enter scientific or technological uncertainties faced

fields.label: **What work was done to overcome these?**
fields.infoText: **What work was done to overcome these?**

fields.id: What type of work should I include?
fields.label: What type of work should I include?
fields.infoText:
You should tell us more about the direct R&D activities that
try to resolve the scientific or
technological uncertainties, and some on qualifying indirect activities.

Direct activities may include: 

- creating or adapting software, materials or equipment needed to resolve the uncertainty
- planning activities such as a detailed plan of how you will carry out the project
- designing, testing and analysis to resolve the scientific or technological uncertainty

Indirect activities may include: 

- promoting a new or improved process, material, device, product or service
- work to create non-scientific or non-technological features of a new or improved process, material, device, product or service
- producing and distributing goods and services
- general support services such as transportation, storage, cleaning, repair, maintenance and security

Qualifying indirect activities form part of the project, but do not directly lead to resolving the uncertainty. 

They include:

- creating information services for R&D support such as preparing a report of R&D findings
- ancillary activities needed to begin R&D, for example, taking on and paying staff, leasing laboratories and maintaining research and development equipment including computers used for R&D purposes)
- training required to support the R&D project
- research by students and researchers carried out at universities
- research including data collection to make new scientific or technological testing, survey, or sampling methods, where this research is not R&D in its own right
- feasibility studies to inform the strategic direction of a specific R&D activity

fields.helpText: Summarise the actions you took to resolve the uncertainties. Keep to 3,000 characters (including spaces), or 500 words
fields.errorMessage: Enter work done to overcome these uncertainties

fields.errorMessage: Enter total qualifying expenditure for this project

fields.infoText: **What advance in that knowledge did you aim to achieve?**

fields.label: What counts as advanced knowledge or capability?
fields.infoText:
The improvement can be physical or not, and a competent professional would recognise it as a significant improvement.
For example, you made a new or efficient cleaning product, material, device, service or improved an existing process, which results in cost savings or less waste

fields.helpText: List the goals of your R&D project, and explain what changes you made to the knowledge or capability so it is better than before in 1000 words
fields.errorMessage: Enter the knowledge you aimed to achieve

fields.label: What scientific or technological uncertainties were faced?
fields.errorMessage: Enter scientific or technological uncertainties faced

fields.label: What uncertainties should I outline?
fields.infoText: Uncertainties are when you don't know how the product or process can be created from your research. For example, you turn a sofa that research and development show is workable into a sofa bed, but it requires further work before going to market.

fields.helpText: Explain what problems you found from research that the product, devise, material or process is workable in 1000 words
fields.errorMessage: Enter scientific or technological uncertainties faced

fields.label: What work was done to overcome these?
fields.errorMessage: Enter work done to overcome these

fields.label: What R&D activities should I include?
fields.infoText:
The activities must directly or indirectly try to resolve an element of the scientific or technological uncertainty. 

Direct activities may include: 

- creating or adapting software, materials or equipment needed to resolve the uncertainty
- planning activities such as estimating development time, schedule, resources and a detailed plan of the work
- design, testing and analysis were undertaken to resolve the scientific or technological uncertainty

Indirect activities may include: 

- the commercial and financial steps necessary for innovation
developing and promoting a new or improved process, material, device, product or service
- work to develop non-scientific or non-technological features of a new or improved process, material, device, product or service
- the production and distribution of goods and services
- administration and other supporting services
- general support services such as transportation, storage, cleaning, repair, maintenance and security

Qualifying indirect activities form part of the project but do not directly lead to resolving the uncertainty. 
They are:

- scientific and technical information services for R&D support such as preparing a report of R&D findings
- indirect supporting activities such as maintenance, security, administration and clerical operations, and finance and personnel activities are undertaken for R&D
- ancillary activities essential to the undertaking of R&D (e.g. taking on and paying staff, leasing laboratories and maintaining research and development equipment including computers used for R&D purposes)
- training required to support an R&D project directly
- research by students and researchers carried out at universities
- research including related data collection to make new scientific or technological testing, survey, or sampling methods, where this research is not R&D in its own right
feasibility studies to inform the strategic direction of a specific R&D activity

You can also include other things like
- a breakdown of your total costs and how they were apportioned to the R&D project, for example, the percentage of total staff costs or utility costs used
- show that subcontractor or external staff payments were reduced to 65%

sections.title: Have you claimed an R&D tax credit for this period?
sections.description: If your company has incurred a loss, you can either carry it forward against trading profits in the future or give it up for a cash payment.

fields.errorMessage: Select yes or no if you have claimed a R&D tax credit

sections.title: What is your company's unused trading loss for this period?

fields.label: Trading loss
How do I work out my unused trading loss?
fields.infoText:
The unused trading loss is:

* the company's trading loss (where the company has spent more than it has made in an accounting period)

* less any other Corporation Tax profits of the claim period 

* less any loss relief claimed

fields.label: declabel
fields.infoText: By submitting this form, you declare that the information that you have provided is true and complete.
If you give incomplete or inaccurate information, we may charge a financial penalty or even prosecute you.

We have sent you a confirmation email.

This is your last opportunity to print or save a PDF copy of your submitted form.

In most cases we aim to either pay the tax credit, or contact you about your application within 28 days.

If we do not hold accurate Bacs (Bankers Automated Clearing System) details, your payment will take longer to process.

If we think the cost details may be incorrect, we aim to open an enquiry within 60 days. HMRC will contact you regarding the enquiry.
